The H1B Sponsor Checker is a Chrome extension tool designed to help job seekers and professionals easily verify if a company sponsors H1B visas. With this tool, you can quickly search for employers and view their H1B approval records for recent years—all in one place.

Key Features:

Quick Search Functionality: Simply start typing the employer's name, and after three characters, a dropdown list of matching companies will appear.

Detailed Approval Data: For companies that sponsor H1B visas, instantly view their approval numbers for 2023, 2022, and 2024 (To Be Added).

Local Data Processing: All operations occur locally on your browser—no data is collected, shared, or transmitted. 

User-Friendly Interface: A sleek and intuitive design with features like a racetrack-style button, dynamic placeholder text, dropdown menu and a learn more webpage. 

How It Works:

1. Download the extension from the Chrome web store. 
2. Open the extension from the toolbar and type in the employer's name.
3. After entering at least three characters, matching company names       will appear.
4. Select a company from the list and click the 'Check' button to see its H1B sponsorship details or find out if it doesn’t sponsor (Company not listed in the database).

Why Use H1B Sponsor Checker?

Save time by accessing all relevant information in one place. A process that otherwise takes around 50 seconds should be cut down to around 10 seconds. 
Make informed career decisions with accurate and up-to-date data.
Enjoy complete privacy with a tool that doesn’t collect or share your personal information.

Privacy Policy

Your privacy is my top priority. This extension processes all data locally on your browser, and no user data is collected, stored, or transmitted.

Model: 
My Chrome extension has the following files:

manifest.json: Metadata and permissions.
popup.html: The UI of my plugin.
popup.js: Handles user interactions and communicates with the backend database.
styles.css: Styles the plugin UI.
database.json: Where the normalized data is stored locally. 

Data Model: 

The data is modeled from the dataset I obtained from the USCIS official website. I collected the data, cleaned it for redundancy, efficiency, accessibility and integrity. I then converted the dataset into json and use that local dataset.json file to check if a company is a H1B sponsored or not. 

Get Started Today!

Install the H1B Sponsor Checker and make your job search faster and more efficient.


***NOTE: On the website, the download buttons do not work. It will lead you back to the webpage. The download link will lead to the correct location (Chrome store) once the extension is approved by the google team.
